content.description: Bolted line on the left. All climbs start with one bolt down low. This route shares the same 3 bolts as the crack climb in the middle of the wall, but continues to trend up and left on bolts and great knobs. A 70m rope barely makes it down, tie knots in the end of your rope and lower your climber onto the uphill slope to be safe.
content.location: Look for bottom bolt that is start of all 3 routes on the slab (painted hanger). Continue bolt line up and left, passing the crack climb in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Get ready to get bendy! Prepare yourself for some full-body mantles onto knobs, doing the splits above your bolt, and maybe even a slab-dyno! A fun slab classic for sure.
content.location: Start of the route shares the same bottom bolt as the previous two routes, but follow a separate bolt line up more or less straight up. 6 bolts total to a 2-bolt anchor.

content.description: Follow three bolts on the slab down low to meet up with the fun layback crack above. Traverse right at the roof to reach a 2-bolt anchor on a good ledge. Probably a single rack to 3" is fine with extras in the 0.5-#1 camalot range.
content.protection: 3 Bolts and gear to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: This is the main obvious crack that starts about 25 feet up the slab start and leads to a small roof traverse
